info.title: SFTP
info.description: SFTP (SSH File Transfer Protocol) is a network protocol that provides file access, file transfer, and file management over any reliable data stream. It was designed by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) as an extension of the Secure Shell protocol (SSH) version 2.0 to provide secure file transfer capabilities.

get.description: This operation gets file metadata using the file id.

put.description: This operation updates the file content. If a file is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was updated, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming recently updated file.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Content of the file to update

patch.description: This operation appends to a file.

get.description: This operation gets file metadata using the file path.
This operation gets file contents using the file path.
This operation gets file contents using the file id.

post.description: This operation uploads a file to an SFTP server. If a file is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was created, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming newly created file.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Content of the file to create

post.description: This operation copies a file to an SFTP server. If a file is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was copied, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming newly created file.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Path to the destination file, including file name

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination file if set to 'true'

get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a file is added in a folder. The trigger will fetch both the file metadata as well as the content of the file. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.
get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a file in the folder you selected.

get.summary: When a file is added or modified
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a file is added or modified in a folder. The trigger will fetch both the file metadata as well as the content of the file. The trigger relies on the last modified time of a file. If a file is being created by a third-party client, the preservation of the last modified time should be disabled in the client. Files larger than 50 megabytes are skipped by the trigger. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: includeFileContent
parameters.description: If set to true, file content will also be retrieved along with the trigger response

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add or change a file in the folder you selected.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return by single trigger run (1-100). Note that 'Split On' setting can force trigger to process each item individually.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of files to return from the trigger

get.summary: When a file is added or modified (properties only)
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a file is added or modified in a folder. This trigger will only fetch the file metadata. To get the file content, you can use the "Get file content" operation. The trigger relies on the last modified time of a file. If a file is being created by a third-party client, the preservation of the last modified time should be disabled in the client. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of files to return by single trigger run (1-100). Note that 'Split On' setting can force trigger to process each item individually.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Number of files to return from the trigger

parameters.name: checkBothCreatedAndModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: If the flag is set to true, the trigger will check the file's created date and time and the file's last modified date and time. If the flag is set to false, the trigger will only check the file's last modified date and time.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add or change some files in the folder you selected.

get.description: This operation gets files contained in a folder.
This operation gets the files in the root folder.

post.description: This operation extracts an archive file into a folder (example: .zip).

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Overwrites the destination files if set to 'true'

Id.description: The unique id of the file or folder.

Name.description: The name of the file or folder.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the file or folder.

Path.description: The path of the file or folder.

LastModified.description: The date and time the file or folder was last modified.

Size.description: The size of the file or folder.

MediaType.description: The media type of the file or folder.

IsFolder.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether or not the blob is a folder.

ETag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The filelocator of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The filelocator of the file or folder.

BlobMetadataPage.description: Represents a page of blob metadata.
